items.q: Who was the first President of the United States?
The Titanic sank on its maiden voyage.
items.explanation: It hit an iceberg and sank in April 1912.

items.q: Julius Caesar was an Emperor of China.
items.explanation: Julius Caesar was a Roman general and statesman.

items.q: What ancient civilization built the pyramids in Egypt?
items.explanation: The pyramids served as monumental tombs for pharaohs.

items.q: Who is known for discovering America in 1492 for Spain?
items.explanation: His voyages led to the widespread European exploration of the Americas.

items.q: What wall was built across northern China to protect it from invaders?
items.explanation: It was built and rebuilt over centuries.

items.q: Who was the famous civil rights leader who delivered the 'I Have a Dream' speech?
items.explanation: He delivered it during the 1963 March on Washington.

items.q: What country gifted the Statue of Liberty to the United States?
items.explanation: It was a gift of friendship from the people of France.

items.q: Who was the Queen of the United Kingdom for over 70 years, ending her reign in 2022?
items.explanation: She was the longest-reigning British monarch.

items.q: Which Native American woman helped the Lewis and Clark expedition?
items.explanation: She acted as an interpreter and guide.
